I enjoyed going to the top of the Tower. Great views and ride up was very quick with no lines. Compared to SkyTree in Tokyo it was much more relaxed.
Nice views especially at night. Located on top floor of what used to be japan's tallest building. Drinks can be expensive however the views worth it.
Though nothing much as attraction for a tourist, but you can visit this tower for shopping, eating, and having a look of whole Yokohama from the top.

Thought we had probably had to try and see as much as we could as only in the city for the day and here we saw everything from a great height. The lift goes from first to sixty ninth floor in 35 seconds. The views are spectacular, you really can see Tokyo!

The Landmark Tower is not among the tallest buildings in the world, but not far behind. Other than the Sky Tree in Tokyo, it is the tallest building in Japan and provides a fabulous view of the Yokohama waterfront and city. The cost of 1000 yen (less for seniors) is reasonable

Very colourful city in the evening and there was plenty to do in the tower. We got our cartoonish portrait painted in the tower, which was quite a souvenir. However, we don't know if it was worth the trip from Tokyo as the area surrounding seemed like a business district.
Though a bit pricey to get to the top on a clear day it's quite fantastic. One can see the entire Y bay and all the main buildings.

Landmark Tower used to be the highest building in Japan. Now it is any more, but the view from its Sky Garden is still worth to admire. You can take a look of the entire Minato Mirai areas. Its night view is really impressive.

When you get to the viewing floor of this you can enjoy a sight as far as the eye can see of the area. There is an entrance fee to get in, that is quite the only negative in this.

The tallest structure in Yokohama, it offers great view of the Yokohama city and its adjoining bay area. There is an entry fee to be paid for getting to the view point atop the building but its worth spending.
Great views from the top of the tower. You can more or less see all of Yokohama and even Mount Fuji during a clear day.

A nice place to get a view of Yokohama. There are restaurants and a few things to do up there too - such as getting a fun caricature portrait or a little souvenir shopping in.

We went to look out at the harbour and view and you will not be disappointed . So clear and the lights wow with the Ferris wheel right there . We had some cocktails and then dinner down stairs

text.wiki:
The Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse (横浜赤レンガ倉庫, Yokohama Akarenga Sōko) is a historical building that is used as a complex that includes a shopping mall, banquet hall, and event venues. The complex, officially known as the Newport Pier Bonded Warehouse (新港埠頭保税倉庫, Shinkō Futō Hozei Sōko), was originally used as customs buildings, and has two sections: Warehouse No.1 and No.2. It is operated by Yokohama Akarenga Co. Ltd., and located at the Port of Yokohama in Naka-ku, Yokohama, Kanagawa, Japan.


== History ==

In the late 19th century, the Yokohama city government worked on constructing new harbour facilities, and the first reclamation work was begun in 1899. The work, completed in 1905, was followed by expansion work which ended a year later. Planned by a Japanese architect and a government official, Tsumaki Yorinaka, the current Building No. 2 was constructed in 1911, and the current Building No. 1 was erected in 1913. Both were to be used as customs houses.

When the 1923 Great Kantō earthquake struck Yokohama, the red brick buildings were damaged, but suffered less than other buildings due to their reinforced structure with iron implanted between the bricks. Repair work continued until 1930, and after World War II, the buildings were requisitioned by the American occupation troops between 1945 and 1956. After the buildings were returned to Japan, their use decreased with the advent of containerization, and the buildings ended their role as customs houses in 1989.
In 1992, Yokohama city acquired jurisdiction over the buildings, and restoration work was carried out from 1994 to 1999. This work, in which the roof and structure of the buildings were strengthened, was conducted by Takenaka Corporation, a Japanese architectural company. After the inside of the buildings was renovated, they were opened as the Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse on April 12, 2002.


== Overview ==

The complex is divided into buildings No. 1 and No. 2. Both buildings are three stories high, and are 22.6 metres wide and 17.8 metres tall. The area of Building No. 1 is 5,575 m², with a length of 76 metres, while Building No. 2 has a total area of 10,755 m², and a length of 149 metres.Building No. 1 is regarded as a cultural facility, and is utilized as an event venue for art exhibitions, film festivals, musical competitions and plays. Building No. 2 houses a shopping mall and restaurant arcade, and a balcony from which visitors can view the harbour opened on the 3rd floor in 2007. Other sightseeing spots including Yokohama Chinatown, Minato Mirai 21, and Yamashita Park are located nearby.


== Sports ==
On December 10, 2018, it was announced that the Final Stage of SASUKE 36's special would be broadcast live from the Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse on TBS on New Year's Eve.  The 2019 edition of SASUKE's Final Stage will once again be broadcast live from the warehouse on December 31, 2019. It will be the 2nd consecutive SASUKE tournament to have a live Final Stage.

text.quote: Former brick warehouse, now a shopping & cultural center with stores, cafes & seasonal events.
trip: The Red Brick Warehouse is home to numerous shops and restaurants and is quintessential Yokohama. You must visit if you’re in town.
The famous red brick warehouse is nice place to chill, it’s a bit far but can go there by bus. You can also know a bit of history of the brick house
Rehabilitated old warehouse turns into a collection of trendy shops and nice restaurants. Nice view of the city both day and night from the balcony.

A must-go when you are in Yokohama, its a huge building that used to be a warehouse now converted into shops. There are many unique items for sale there by independent designers, some are quite nice. I bought a soap that felt like jelly. There is also a large lawn in front where

So, we walked the entire length of the waterway park, started up at Chinatown, and took our time through the park. Thankfully it was a nice warm and sunny day. This Red Brick Warehouse is pretty much just an indoor shopping place with a few eatery's. It was wall to wall
My girlfriend and I purposely walked to this place for the view and instantly in loved in this unique warehouse, we ended up spending the whole evening here due to how amazing this place is.

Enjoyed watching the outdoor ice skating and the wonderful shopping inside. Good food with a great atmosphere.

We visited in the afternoon before the crowds- lots of great shops inside and we were lucky to also have the Christmas market outside. Worth a visit to browse or buy.

Quality commercial center dwelled in two old red brick sea port warehouses fortunately preserved during the port area re-development. Lot of nice and quality little shops resembling a flea market with also good choice of inexpensive eating places.

when I was here there was an event going on and the place buzzed with people. interesting shops, eateries, lots of people but there is also some large areas of open space from which one can get some interesting views of the port, the ships and the occasional jumping fish.

This was highly recommended and I am glad we attended. Some of the stores are purely trinkets and souvenirs, but the other stores are high quality, little known brands. The food market and restaurant life is great quality! I would recommend anyone visiting Yokohama goes and has

We can enjoy this summer with the fake beach valley ball set up there. Even in the winter they have outside skate rink... You can enjoy sea side walk in the same time. Also you can take Red Brick bus Public Yokohama City bus take you to there from Sakuragi cho Station. It is

We toured the red brick warehouse a couple of times. This is the second time we have been here in are two visits to Yokohama. Lots of shops, food and people. Spend some time here for a good selection of local food.

The lineups for restaurants are pretty long but worth the wait for a large group. You can find standard Japanese one person seating eatery downstairs, or special event tents outside (it was beach theme event)

went on the sea bass to visit the warehouses. a great selection pf places to eat ad well as a lovely selection of shops selling local crafts and other goods. We arrived on the night of a firework festival, so it was busy but a greta place to see the fireworks

Came over because of the pokemon fest 2019. Went to the brickhouse for a visit. Understand the history. Near the flyer. Nice place but maybe quiet at night. If you want a romantic night, then this place is good for couple.

When arrived there there was just a safety dril for Incase disaster happened so all personal was standing outside, together with the people from safety and fire department, so we had to wait more than an hour before could get inside, inside there are several small boutiques with

It is convienently located with cup noodle musuem within walking distance. Enjoy the vibes of this place. Plus we had a great weather. Spotted a few good buys at this warehouse. Enjoy a good break at this place too.

Both of the converted warehouses (used to be the Port Customs Inspection Houses) - with 3 levels in each - now have retail shops and restaurants with different themes in each. Couldn’t believe the amount of shoppers! Unbeknownst to us, they had a “Fruhlings Fest Brau Garten”

This is a complex of two historical brick warehouses which was originally built in in 1911 & 1913. These buildings served as the custom warehouse for the Port of Yokohama. It has now been refurbished and now has wonderful shops, small eateries and restaurants located within.

This little mall is comprised of two separate buildings. One has a bunch of small, mainly souvenir oriented shops and the other mainly restaurants. The shops were nothing impressive so I can’t say this is a must visit place.
Food and clothing items mostly. Shop after shop more of the same. Not very interesting. Had high hopes but alas- dashed...
A collection of shops and restaurants in a historical building. Often special events on the grounds around them.

When I saw this I was pleased as they are reusing historical buildings for modern use which I really like as they have done so well in other places such as London A festival of beer was on when we were there which livened the place up no end but really brought the area to life

This was a place I came across as I was meeting up with a friend who suggested that we meet here, Being December, I found that there were several shops inside and some eateries as well. More eateries were on the outside of this building and there was also a small skating rink.

does not open until late in the morning , we found it difficult tofind the right door but it was intersting inside
The buildings are beautifully restored and it's a wonderful wander through them, up and down stairways, meandering through the various artisan shops.

The Red Brick warehouse Building is a place to see at least once when you go to Yokohama. It’s just right beside the pier and you would be able to walk there from the Yamashita Park. A lot of visitors take pictures of the building, with it’s bold deep red colour. Inside you’ll
An easy walk from Osanbashi Cruise Terminal. The Haneda Airport Limousine Bus starts from there. One building opens at 10.00 and the other at 11.00 Good views of the harbour and plenty of shops
This was a nice place to visit. The grounds are spacious and pretty. We had lunch here, good choices, but a bit crowded and expensive.
Nice mall in a historic building, handmade crafts , hats, whatever you can think of, you will find it here...

lots of restos on the ground floor and on the top floor nice to walk with couples 3 storey structure

Inside the building there were many souvenir stores and restaurants. But, they already lost their Japanese taste. The price also very expensive. So, for me what good in this building was only a good place for taking picture.

It is a beautiful place to walk around, located right on the water. The buildings are lovely. There are a ton of shops, some offering unique products. There are also restaurants and bars. They are a little on the pricey side, but good quality. You will need time to see

The only Place where I could find beautiful Kokeshi dolls and many other Souviers. Hosts over 25 stores. We had our lunch at Chano Ma inside Red brick house. It had this option of Mattress seating where you can chill and relax. Food was ok but drinks and starters were good.
Great evening visit, to browse the little shops and great place to eat... only comment could do with more lighting outside....

The red brick building is one of the iconic building in the city. Housed variety of good restaurants and Japanese souvenirs. Head to this place when you’re in the city.

Shops and cafe scream hipster from top to bottom. Don't recommend spending money here. Go out to the balcony and take pics as the views of the sea are lovely.

This place is called “Aka Renga Soukou” in Japanese and you might know since this as most road signage to this place is in this name rather than “Red brick warehouse”. There are basically two red brick old warehouses ( one smaller)converted to shopping malls.Options of food are
There are two large buildings in the complex with assorted food trucks, etc. Nice view of the port and surrounded by some green space. Pleasant but unremarkable.
I was lucky to visit durning the oktober fest so my experience was even better I had a lot of fun. Worth it

Not far from cruise terminal, or Nihonbashi railway station. Converted warehouses with multiple shops, and places to eat, including full meals, or coffee and cake. Take time to browse and wander in Yokohama.

Great old historical buildings that have been restored and house shops and market stalls. Lots of arty stores and a great all round vibe. Nice views of the harbour from there also.

Definitely worth the visit, the place and the surroundings is beautiful with an ocean view and lots of places to go into and have lunch, it is very easy to pass the time there and walking around was a beautiful experience view and lots of places to go into and have lunch, it is

My husband and I spent the better half of Saturday strolling through this wonderful old building which was full of people, excitement and the spending of Yen! The atmosphere is great, the shops are of many varieties and there are plenty of eateries on the ground floor with bars

Nice place to take photos. Had dinner at the Fisherman's Wharf, it was a delightful experience with all sorts of seafood dishes, mouthwatering desserts. My favorite was the snow crab legs. There were a lot of stores offering knickknacks, some a bit on the pricey side, though.
We came here via the hop on hop off bus. Great place with a lot of Arts & Craft shops. Some eating places as well.
a good place to visit because the building is unique and you find a lot of cute things to buy from Japan! The pancake cafe is very delicious..

I visited this warehouse complex in the evening. The complex has 2 buildings. One of them is an event hall, which was closed at my time of visit. The other building offers locals and tourists a quaint shopping and dining experience. First floor is mainly restaurants, cafes, food
Great for souvenir shopping or just shopping in general, cute atmosphere and plenty of places to eat/drink.

We enjoyed running around the warehouse. I ended up getting a beer at BeerNext restaurant. The menu look nice and maybe next time will order food. We did some looking around all the shops and ended up only getting a small umbrella to keep the sun blocked.

Quirky gifts and great food to be had here. Visit Bills for a great meal. My go to spot every time I’m in town.

Well If you hunt for some good photo spots, its a good place. but for shopping itself , its pricey. there is food court with local and tourist enjoying this place

This beautiful spot near Yokohama World Porters is clean fishing well operated shopping, dining and entertaining area.

If you are in Yokohama, this is definitely a must to visit place! We’ve been there in December, so they were doing some Christmas events and a Christmas Market. All the stores were also very interesting and bought some Japanese souvenirs. It’s not a place to go if you do not
There's always something good going on here be it a beer festival, local crafts and manufacturers stalls or even car shows (Nissan) If in the area always worth have a walk in and checking it out.

Historical warehouses from the 1899 turned into modern fancy shopping mall and event space for art and music plays: 2 main buildings with 3 floors, has very curated shops and atmosphere, theres also an nice ice skating ring during Xmas season

Rounded off our day trip to Yokohama with a visit to Red Brick warehouse to see the Christmas decorations and market. Tons of German good being sold in the food kiosks. Worth a visit!
Fantastic old bond store restored beautifully. Right near international cruise terminal. Food and coffee wonderful. Prices similar to AUS.

Since it is decorated for Christmas season, there is German style Christmas market now! With a band playing all Christmas carols. The illumination of the plaza is pretty and cute.

Wonderful old red brick build with quirky, but very expensive shops offering all sorts of Japanese and Yokohama products. Be warned some items we saw elsewhere for much cheaper prices. You wander from shop to shop and floor to floor immersed in lots of colour and quality. Very
Out of a historical place, it’s also a good one to visit and do shopping. Got some souvenirs here and a beer as a stop. Highly recommend to visit here.

Historic warehouse buildings converted in to restaurants, bars and shops - should be a great opportunity to produce something very atmospheric. Somehow, it just misses - needs more outdoor bars and cafes, along with a better selection of shops - at the moment, just too much tat

We went in May and they were having a German Beer festival. Oktoberfest but a different name I can’t recall. It was fun. Lots going on. Not sure what it would be like on an average day but lots of food and lots of beer.

We visited Yokohama on a rainy day... went into this warehouse which was converted to house shops inside. Many shops selling handmade goods, accessories, souvenirs, clothes and many more. There are some restaurants inside as well. We finished browsing in about an hour and left

because joining the marathon, it have a chance to visit the warehouse. the warehouse was located at the pier side, which could take a good photo for sun set. the ware house had two block, and had different restaurant and shop. this full of young people and family and visitor.

The Oktoberfest was held next to the Red Brick Warehouse, but there were still hundreds of people in the Warehouse as that was free to enter and had a variety of foods for sale on the ground floor. Apparently it is a very cool place to be seen.

I was lucky with the weather while in Yokohama and took a long walk around the port and went to see the old red brick warehouse. There as a street market ongoing full of people and families having something to eat or shopping things and I spent a lovely morning around. Nice

Arrived early morning and dropped our bags at the hotel grabbed some maps and set out to explore. The red brick warehouses had some great little shops and some really good little food places. We enjoyed strolling around and the ambience of the buildings.
What it is is a bunch of old buildings converted into restaurants and stores, my opinion extremely poorly done, and a total waste the time to attend

Beautiful old red brick buildings lovingly restored and now houses boutiques and cafes. Well worth a stroll! If you’re lucky, the area outside the building is used for festivals and events. We were lucky enough to stumble upon Oktoberfest!

A perfect place from which to view the harbor, see Yokohama in action and people watch with the sea breeze.
Red brick warehouse. I walked round this facility. But they had obviously had an event with stalls the previous day and not much was going on

History, Shops, Food, Fun! Quick walk from the Hotels and Historic locations of Beautiful Yokohama Bay!

Is located next to intercontinental yokohama and the shops inside are some small shops. Selling unique stuff.
A pretty boring place to visit nothing interesting especially when You have kids with you. Just a lazy stroll nothing more. My personal opinion other people may think otherwise
Go place if you're after hand made Japanese goods, has a hipster vibe. A bit hit and miss because most things are quiet expensive

The red brick warehouse is a great place to take some pictures. It is a cool building on the outside and is right on the water. Inside are just tourist shops and restaurants. There is a nice garden nearby.
Nice little set of shops for gifts and food but some of them where quite expensive. Did have a nice atmosphere and the architecture of the buildings themselves is pretty cool considering its age

One of main reasons for I fell in love with Yokohama is the city deep rooting with its own history, and the tendency in preserving modern historical building rather than just scrapping them. This is more like Europe than Japan, isn't it? So you come here, in the "Aka Renga
This was a short walk from our cruise ship but unfortunately we went early and nothing was open. I don't think we missed a lot anyway.

This is an interesting part of Yokohama and provides good views of the bridge over Tokyo Bay as well as the old red brick buildings that date back to the Meiji and Taisho periods. Once warehouses they are now commercial establishments.

Red brick warehouse is literally just that. Some old warehouses made from red brick on waterfront with many shops. Felt it was overpriced. Also the food is much better on other side of train station in Nogecho area
Don't come before 11AM. The shops don't open early in Japan. Restored customs warehouse from the Meiji Restoration. Beautiful and clean, just like everything else in Japan.

It was the 15th anniversary when we visited & there were lots of activity in the event plaza, it was very busy but was great to be part of the celebrations. The picnic areas are lovely with great ocean views.

Nice place for photo shoot daytime & nighttime....feel different moments for me I prefer night moments....more "Red feeling" A lot of restaurant.... nice place when you come for this area YOKOHAMA... * Cup noodle museum * Yokohama Giant Wheel * Yokohama China Town * Yokohama

Great to see old buildings given a new lease on life, however they appear to be just another mall. Shops of all shapes and sizes, food stalls and escalators. Excellent open spaces and well serviced by the 100 Yen bus.

By the name itself, you will wonder what is inside these warehouses. It came as a surprise to see various restauarants - traditional and fusion inside these buildings as well as stores selling various items.
This is in Yokohama Bay area ansd is a worthwhile day outing especially if it is raining.The area is HUGE with many small market type shops offering all things including foods. A nice place to visit.

This place is a must-see for 1st-time visitors to Yokohama. It is easily accessible by bus or by foot. This historical spot is now filled with shops and cafes that offer a great view of the city's skyline and harbor.

This venue gets so crowded that it is nearly impossible to walk freely through it. Young families with small children seem to gravitate to it as well as teens and the under 40 crowd. The building itself is interesting from a historical point of view and the renovation and
It was renovated from the old warehouse and there are restaurants and shops inside. So it is a nice spot to take a few photos outside, but not much to do inside.

横浜ならではの雑貨ショップあり、おしゃれ小物商品が充実した店舗展開です。食事もファストフードながらこだわりを持ったお店ばかりでどこで食べるか迷うのも楽しいですよ。店内でいただくのも良いですが数店舗で買い求めて外の公園でいただくのも海を眺めながら、おすすめです。"AKARENNGA SOUKO" is The Red brick depot. There is nice shops ,first food and restaurant.
Kids have options on food choices as do teenagers and adults. Shops are plentiful and appeal to everyone. Loved it.

Went to the Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse with a local friend, and it was a great experience. It's like a luxury flea market with many creative handmade souvenirs. I personally appreciate any great architecture in the world, and Red Brick Warehouse is one of the greatest.
Wandered around but didn't really take to this place. Found it rather cramped and uninspiring. Too many retail units?

The day we visited, there was a German beer festival being held adjacent to the building which gave it a fantastic atmosphere. Plea to oflittle shops and eateries within the building, the shops sold mostly jewellery and souvenirs which were not cheap but seemed a little better

When you pass by you can easily see a long industrial kind of building but when you enter inside there are shopping stores with silver jewelries, sovereigns and also restaurants at the top floor. From corridor you can see Ferries wheel too along with the Landmark.

The red brick warehouses have been converted into shops and restaurants to cater for tourists as well as local people particularly during weekends and festival periods. The place was centrally located between the JR stations and cruise terminal along the coast. During our

Whether you just want to browse the many souvenir and local stores or enjoy a beverage and meal this is a must see when in Yokohama. Easy to walk to or get the hop on hop off bus. Well laid out, clean, friendly.

Red brick is aside by Minato Mirai 21, it's suitable for either tourist and local residents. It's a place with the mixture of culture, morden and historical. Can also find lovely food and interesting stores here. Moreover, there is shuttle bus operating around, or can rent a

There are shops, some pricey and some less so. Good for a lot of shopping merchandise in one area. The 4 of us had ramen for supper from one of the food court cafes. We walked about 20 minutes from our Chinatown hotel (Rose Yokohama). It was a good place for a couple of hours

Went to this place after my visit to China town. This place is a 15-20 minutes walk from Bashamichi line. On your way saw a beautiful views of the buildings and park that leads to warehouse. It has got beautiful shops and dining on level 3. Plan the trip in such a way that

Lots of neat souvenirs , crafts inside, accessible to everything. Food court inside has great matcha desserts, drinks and omurice selections. We happened to be there during the Yokohama Flower Festival so everything was beautiful.
It is a huge mall. Make sure you bring good walking shoes. Definitely a place to visit while in Yokohama

It's a little out of the way but it's well worth a visit. There are stalls selling some pretty cool items, not just your typical Japanese souvenirs. Some nice food there too, including a really good apple pie shop.
The old building is interesting and there are a few unique shops. Most of the stuff for sale is available everywhere so it's a bit hard to get excited about yet another shopping mall.
Easily accessible by public bus, covered by day pass. Renovated warehouse with 2 blocks/ wings filled with cute shops and restaurants. Inside there is a claimed to be the best breakfast place- Bills.
This is a good place to buy souvenirs and locally made crafts. Some interesting shops that tell about the girl with the red shoes. You can buy jewelry , handbags, craft and lots of food.

This quaint old-style building on the water is very relaxing. We enjoyed a wonderful time exploring all the quaint shops and boutiques. There are many smaller restaurants and cafes with something for everyone.

This was a good place to go on a rainy April Saturday afternoon in Yokohama to spend a hour or so...looking in shops and buying a pork bao. The outside of the buildings are impressive from the 1880's Meiji Period (used as a bonded warehouse until the late 1980's)...and during
The 2 warehouses have been transformed into shops and restaurants. It is a nice place to poke around to buy some souvenirs and have a casual meal while waiting for the slot at the Cup Noodle museum
It's a cool place with great architecture. It's near the sea and there are shops inside the warehouse with great things and really cool postcards. The place is beautiful and picture worthy.
The Red Brick area has something going on all the time. This week was the strawberry fest. Japan has the best strawberries. This area has many shops.. resturants and cafes.
Beautiful place. Inside is a mall, Small hallways off course since it was a warehouse, but it is absolutely incredible. Perfect place if you want to walk and enjoy the view of the bay. Recommended.

My friends and I visited the Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse on the Saturday that we happened to be in Yokohama for our business trip. The place was absolutely packed with locals and tourists. There was a Strawberry Festival going on so there were many people. There was also an
It is a shopping district cum food court in an old setting. Those who yearn for the past, may have a good time. Nothing extra ordinary.
If you visit Yokohama take the effort and give a try. Chances are that you come acrid a festival or any sort of function. If not have nice snack: meal in the vicinity.

Interesting shops with local crafts and fare. Beautifully redone building with original architecture - love these repurposed buildings. Can be a little crowded on weekends but work a quick walk through while you are down at the waterfront.
It's worth a walk through. Some interesting small shops but seemed a tourist trap. The food court was like all the other malls. I did like the glass works shop. I just could not love it.
A neat place to walk around and window shop to warm up from the cold, but items were priced very high. Food was also pricey.

Yet another shopping place in Japan, though full of places to eat as well. This old warehouse turned shopping venue is filled with small and somewhat unique shops, if you are into shopping then stop by you won't be disappointed.
Nicely located, it is a interesting point to visit and to have a walk around. Its for free and nice for a sunny day.

This is one of the spot I prefer in Yokohama. From this place you can admire the view of the Bay Bridge, Minato Mirai and Landmark tower. If you are hungry, just walk inside the buildings and you will find all types of food you can image!
Red Brick Warehouses were good to have a look around at the different shops and stall but very crowded, shoulder to shoulder in most parts. Food & souvineir shops here are expensive too.

Located in Minatomiarai Area, there are many sightseeing spots. These were warehouses and renovated to be shopping malls for visitors selling various kinds of sovenirs branded as YOKOHAMA.Located along the port, can view bay. Nearest Station is Nihonodori Station, Minatomirai
Prices for goods and food at exorbitant rates. Great place for sight seeing only but not for shopping.

During our visit, there was skating rink. Various cafes and restaurants and also the usual desserts and sweets that Japan is known for. There is also a shop selling those fake food displays tat are usually display outside jaanese restaurants. Great place for shopping befote

Lots of international items in a collection of small shops. Very diverse selection of stores and eateries, but the crowds can be overwhelming, especially when a cruise ship in nearby. There is a bus terminal right outside, or the subway/trains are about 3 decent blocks away.

A good use for a historical building which perhaps otherwise would be derelict, Low ceilings, lots of small eateries and shops, popular and crowded. Not a huge shopper by nature, preferred World Porters which was more open and pleasant.
nice to visit, you can enjoy shopping and good to walk. it's not far from Yokohama station and Minato Mirai.
I was greatly amazed how they constructed this warehouse with such a unique feeling of being part of its history.
Great place to visit for local souvenirs and nice food. Beautiful setting and renovated old building. Many good places to dine.

I really wanted to like this place. We have been to similar converted spaced in Taibei,and have always enjoyed seeing the re-purposed space and shopping at local artsy stalls. This place does neither. The design is poor - with two many floors and low ceilings in what should

The red brick historical buildings have all been renovated, one row now houses shopping and many eateries while the other row has become a museum with an introduction of its history. The area is set in the harbor of Yokohama and surrounded by brand new buildings in what looks

I went there in the weekends and it was really crowded. The old warehouses were transformed into cafes, restaurants and shops. If it's not so crowded, it would have been a better experiences there. I could see many people standing or sitting on the steps relaxing just outside

We visited in December for the Christmas Village. There are many boutiques and vendors selling gifts, decorations and apparel. I was pleasantly surprised to see so many different things. Outside there are booths selling snacks and drinks. The lights are beautiful at night.
atmostphere was nice, able to enjoy some sausages, beer, ice cream... there was also a mini skating rink. good for couple night walk....

The building is a restored warehouse, hence its name, and it currently houses cafes, boutique shops, etc. The items sold here are interesting and would make good souvenirs. Worth popping in for some browsing and a look outside to admire the building architecture. It was crowded

The old warehouses are now home to a plethora of cafes, restaurants, art and craft type shops. The sort of place for a tourist to wander at a leisurely pace while stopping for coffee or lunch to interrupt the browsing.
Nice and cozy place to go for the evening, do some souvenir shopping and get something to eat. Seems like there could be more stores here
Really sticks out compared to the rest of the buildings at Yokohama waterfront. Has some nice boutique shops and restaurants. It's a nice place to escape the cold at the port but it gets very busy!
Best visited on weekends to make sure you see the place in full swing. Crafty space suited to tourists, gift buyers.

Was here on for a concert by Lauren Hill and tlc. Was very crowded, lots of stalls and smal retaurants in tents. Great food. Inside the brick house is a museum and stores. You can find great souvenires and presents for family and friends back home here. Too costly however

This place should be visited when you are in Minato Mirai. You can walk through the building within a few hours but they have cute cafes, craft stores and some sort of events most of the time. This shopping district was built in a historic building that represent Yokohama. Great
Nice to wander around but nothing special. Lots of places closed when we walked through and just touristy overpriced things in other stores.
A good place to visit. Find out if there are any exhibits or fayre's going on. The area is busy with many food outlets on my visit.

This is a great area to wonder through, it has some great bargins. The only problem is that it does not open till late and if that is your main destination, then you loose a lot of your day, so plan accordingly

There is no need to take a ship's tour to see the warehouses. Find a vantage point on the ship and look towards the shore. On your right hand side you will see the red brick buildings. Originally built as custom houses they now include a shopping mall and event venues. The

We met with some friends for a lunch prior to boarding our Cruise. Had a little time to wander through looking at all the shops and dining venues, would have loved more time to explore. It is quite large.

We had been there couple of times, but this place never let you down, Always packed with some event, Recently when we visited, Oktoberfest was going on, packed with people, enjoying their time with beer (bit expensive)

The Red Brick Warehouses were once used as a port, but have now transformed into interesting buildings housing restaurants and shops. There are various festivals and events happening throughout the year: during my visit, there was a gyoza festival! There is no harm in taking in
The Oktoberfest was just in there as we walked to it. Other than that it has a nice view of the port and there are some good shops to look at, you can easily spend an hour exploring this place.

This is located right next to the cruise terminal There are lots of small shops and eateries Good afternoon stroll and scenic to watch the departure of the cruise ships There are interesting small shops e.g. Miniature fake sandwiches,hamburgers ,small glass beads and cake
Shopped, had dinner and there was even an Oktoberfest set up!!!! Such a great location on the water and nice food and shopping. Make sure you find out about the history of the red shoes! I loved it!

紅磚倉庫就像台灣的松菸園區進階放大版，白天與晚上看起來的感覺很不同，白天就很適合在那拍外景照，倉庫內許多文創商品，飲食部分有一家抹茶飲品店的味道很不錯很濃郁，抹茶愛好人士不能錯過；晚上的倉庫與周邊景緻看起來很夢幻，會以為來到偶像劇拍攝地點或那種置身旅遊書美景照的感動，來這景點建議要待到晚上，保證會收穫許多! Yokohama redbrick warehouse is very suitable for someone who like to take a photo. There has wonderful night view you can
Take the water ferry and see the Red Brick Warehouse from the outside. It is a really interesting building next to the modern architecture behind it!

The Red Brick Warehouse, called AkaRenga in Japanese, is a great place to go shopping for special gifts. Inside there is a nice mix of restaurants, jewellery, clothes, foreign food stores and souvenir shops.

The Red Brick Warehouse in Yokohoma is a perfect way to spend a rainy afternoon. Just about an hour by train from Tokyo, these 2 two-story beautiful buildings house shopping, food and history. You can chose from a variety of great restaurants including Bill's. Most of the

One of the best restored shopping precincts around. The distinctive red brick warehouse on the waterfront boasts three floors of shopping, not tourist trap stuff, but genuine cool and good quality goods. Bring your credit card. You can easily spend and hour or more roaming the
Great idea for reusing the building but very crowded inside. If cafes and restaurants can be put outside near the water, the overall atmosphere would be very attractive.

This restored warehouse is worth a one time visit, but is mainly full of touristy type vendors and some decent enough eating establishments. Once you have been there once there really isn't much point in returning, but defintely a good one-off visit.
Essentially a shopping mall. Very crowded and noisy. Worth a quick walk through but not much more. Can get stuffy because of the crowds and smells.

Beautiful historical buildings. Inside and outside. A most see. Inside you'll find many special art craft stores. Something for the whole family. At the food court I can highly recommend Kuala Aina burger. Please enjoy.
The former warehouses have been converted into shops, bars and restaurants. When we were there on a Sunday were loads of stages featuring, mostly, young girls groups. Great atmosphere!

Really neat what they have done preserving these old buildings. Great view of the harbour. You may get to see a cruise ship docked nearby. The gift shops are a bit pricey. Great place to hang out and relax though. Good selection of food, but at tourist prices. USD$6 for shaved

Yokohama Red Brick Warehouses are very nice heritage buildings... Architecturally, they were very werll designed and built, as could be seen at the details of the building.. Surprisingly, the inside of the buildings are vibrant..., they have been turned into commercial spaces

Excellent place to gather and chill out at on a Sunday afternoon especially if the weather is fair and there is an event on such as a Vintage car rally or Octoberfest etc. The Red Brick building has a choice of restaurants as well as other shops. Also one can enjoy the views of

The environment is good and comfortable. There is great sea view for relaxing and the warehouse is good for shopping. Also, there are different restaurants including Beams for variety choice for diners.

When I visited at the end of July, there was a weekend Hawaiian festival going on, so I never got the chance to explore Warehouse 1 due to the crowds everywhere. I did visit Warehouse 2 to order take-out and dessert. The food court area seemed a bit more compacted for space

The well structured building seems like a school or college from outside. But the atmosphere is very nice and lovely inside. Lots of very high quality shops are arranged inside this beautiful building. I strongly recommend visiting this place.
I popped in here toward the end of my visit in Japan and after I had bought souvenirs in Kyoto, Osaka and Tokyo. The collection here was impressive!

It is one of the greatest attraction in Yokohama, it is a warehouse were foreigners can enjoy buying souvenirs for their family and friends, the place is literally a red brick house. It is long and has second floor. There are restaurants as well.
Song go out of your way to go here. Lots of food shops and overpriced souvenirs for tourists. Nice European looking building.

Not much to explore. there are 2 building 1, 2 check openning time before you go. it open 11:00 most of area. the shop are souvenir kind of shopping. some great food there; Bill 's Auzzy famous restuarant is there.

Unfortunately most of visitor does not really take as the memorial place for great historical architecture, since most of them enjoyed just aa shopping mall wit food court and eateries.. Yes, there are a lot of shops and restaurants there, however one should took a little
The view of fresh sea water, fishes, local tourists, ship mueseum and Yokohama coast guard ships- all at Yokohama Red brick Warehouse.

It is an enjoyable venue, an old bond store so you can look at the building construction and security of the day. There are plenty of shops and coffee shops and eateries. It is a pleasant place to visit.

Some nice quality shops with very Japanese gifts. Food court or picnic area is good fun. Join a big table rather than finding one for two or four for a fun experience, the Japanese are so friendly you'll have a richer time.

It's one of those must see once type of place. Great old building re-purposed for modern use. Warehouse 1 is an artisans marketplace. Dozens and dozens of very interesting knick-knacks for sale. All handmade, from leather goods to costume jewelry and custom plants. Unique
If you like wandering through tourist shops this is for you. A nice market style atmosphere and often some outside entertainment

We wondered through the buildings and then had dinner at one of the restaurants. The setting, right on the waterfront, is highly attractive with walkways are gardens all around. In the Red-brick buildings themselves there are many gifts and retail shops and numerous restaurants,
In the morning there are interesting shops open. In the evening many shops are open and interesting restaurant. My favorite place there is Blue Note Jazz Bar. Sometimes great concerts.
My wife and I went to Red Brick Warehouse for dinner. It was romantic to take a walk around the building at night, and we were really delighted.
Absolutely overwhelming array of shops and vendors, shoppers paradise. Didn't ask the prices, don't imagine them to be cheap, but a brilliant atmosphere, nice restaurants etc

The Red Brick building with the shops is a shoppers paradise. It has many different small boutique-style places with plenty of unordinary things. It's certainly not your standard shopping center, and a variety of dining venues are dotted around. And, depending on the time of

A mix of mostly novelty shops and cafes/restaurants. Most you wouldn't give the time of day to but...for us, Yokohama Glass has really interesting pieces and the organic restaurant Grip did lovely organic salad meals at reasonable prices. Worth a wander through. Your tastes may

The place is rather nicely done with a very posh fit-out. Bear in mind that the things aren't cheap. Can get very busy/crowded at night during winter as there is a makeshift skating rink and food stalls. Worth checking out nevertheless.

this is fun place especially at week-ends when all the food stalls, shops are open and full of activity. a real Octoberfest like atmosphere with beer stalls of every description and sausages, you forget you are in Japan!! Easy to get to by bus and also foot depending where you

You have to walk for a bit to get to this 'warehouse'. On a sunny day it's ok. It is located near the harbour so you can see the pier for the large cruise. There are shops and restaurants inside the warehouse and is a great place for a short visit.
...with historical meaning, a really outstanding spot around Yokohama. But I advise to observe it from a distance, the fact that its interior was rebuilt to a shopping area greatly disappointed me.

It rained when we were there in the morning, There was nothing much to see nor to do, The view of the harbor was not that fanta.stic There is a good outlet not far from the warehouse. Shopping lovers would love it.
If you don't interesting in handcraft staff. There totally nothing in there. This place has 2 building the left one full with handcraft shop and the right building has souvenir shop.

Didn't stay too long here as the shops inside didn't interest me. Warehouse buildings have been well restored and updated internally for contemporary standards. I could see people spending a couple of hours here just browsing, eating a meal or having a drink.

I love the environment around here. Bright clear beautiful sky. Enjoying my time here while eating fresh baked waffle and nice hot coffee. there was some filming during our visit but it was so organized and public can still enjoy their time.

To be honest the contents of the warehouse itself isn't touristy. It is geared towards locals with mostly stuff that tourists wouldn't really buy. The design of the warehouse was really great though. Its grounds is also great for pictures and etc. I would pass by the warehouse!

This is not really a destination, but if you are in the area you should see this place. Lots of shops and restaurants. My favorite part is the events that they hold here. Car shows, concerts, German beer festivals. Historical and beautiful. Great place for walk and it can be
Love the sight where you can see the sea and Yokohama pier. The building itself is beautiful, I enjoyed walking inside the building. It gives me the warm and urban feel.
I'd heard a lot about this place but to be honest I was a little disappointed. Very cramped, very hot and very busy. It's about as far away from my idea of Japan as you could get.
This warehouse is converted to a trendy indoor mall with many stores and restaurants. We spent an hour in here. Lots of interesting stores.

The warehouses have been carefully refurbished and hold several restaurants and shops selling jewelry, fragrances, cute stuff toys and other local produce good as gifts for overseas visitors. The price of food looks reasonable. They were setting up for what looks like an outdoor

I like to go here when there is nothing special to do somewhere else. The building itself is interesting in the sense that it's a real warehouse from Meiji Era that has been converted to small shops, restaurants, bars and exhibition space. Sometimes they have some kind of fair
Romantic And beautiful view to see the labor. Variety of restaurant in and out site building also made you satisfy after a tired day.

These old warehouses are interesting in them selves with pretty gardens. There are a number of unique shops which make a change from the designer shops that seem to be the main in surrounding shopping centres.

This is an excellent day out,especially if its raining. Its an Historic building Warehouse full of small shops selling a huge variety of items from glass ware to minature clocks.There is also a great food section,with a selection suitable for all tastes.A top place to visit.
Stunning buildings with the Easter garden display still in progress. Beautifully constructed displays and flowers.
There was leather hand blowen glass wear food . Lively at nite with a waster theme flower show outside the red brick warehouse
Good to see Yokohama Bay and many fancy shops and restaurants. Bills restaurant is recommended and night view of Yokohama Bay and Landmark tower is awesome.

Really easy to find, take the train to Minatomirai, Bashamichi or Nihon-Odori stations (all on the Minatomirai line) and walk toward the bay. It's a couple of streets and then there's a street that parallels the bayside and has all the fun stuff on it (like the cup noodle museum

Yokohama was our last stop during a recent two week visit to Japan. To our surprise we discovered that Yokohama celebrates Oktoberfest at the Red Brick Warehouse! There was a fabulous beer hall on site with an even more fabulous German band (Woho & Kalendar Band) to entertain
This is an old warehouse building converted to shopping mall/ food plaza. There is nothing great about it and its not worth the effort!

This was my second time here. The complex is divided into two buildings. One building is dedicated to arts related activities and you can see contemporary art exhibitions and performances here. The other building is just full of cafes, restaurants and shops which will leave you
This is a cosy quirky building , lots of boutique shops and restaurants , me range pricing Nice to include in the stroll along the water to osanbashi Pier

I love the Red Brick Warehouse! This place has dozens of crafty little stores and boutiques to shop through and little restaurants and cafes to choose from when hunger hits. on the weekends they hold festivals such as Hawaiian weekend, Indian food festival, and even Oktoberfest!

Beautiful old warehouse built in 1911 and later converted into a mall. It has a variety of cafes and restaurants as well as boutiques. The boutiques are all on the pricier side (I found a hair pin that I bought in Shibuya for ¥800 being sold here for ¥1900) but it's worth the
Ok for browsing, but very busy on a Saturday so hard to see much - but what we did see seemed very expensive. I think you're paying for the nice building :o)

Very beautiful, interesting red, colonial buildings with little shops and restaurants inside close to the water. It's winter so there was an ice skating rink to enjoy. You can see the Rainbow Bridge from the shore and ferris wheel rides on the other end.
Great place to visit and chill out. Conviently located just 15 minutes leisure walk from Rose Hotel. There are shops, bars snd restaurants. Retro building reminiscent of colonial wharehouses.
I love this place, even though I don't buy a single thing, except food and enjoy the atmosphere. The food court is splendid and there's a sister club of 'blue note' on the top floor.

A red brick building is not so special for a European person. But inside you can find some interesting things to buy. I bought a beautiful colorful purse for my friend. You can find some interesting clothes also.
Nice place to visit for historical reason...the city had done it up really well...very trendy hangout with a nice food court...the flowers apartment cafe was unique and great to have coffee...

The Red Brick Building is a good place to visit located just along side the estuary. I think at one time they must have been warehouses, and it is good that instead of demolishing them and erecting a new building, the old building has been converted into small retail outlets,

Well situated if you're walking around Yokohama harbour area. A fine example of the architecture of that age, and it seems they have various exhibitions in front of the building throughout the year. When we visited there was a lovely exhibition of Japanese garden designs.

Very nice warehouse style buildings just in front of the port with some nice restaurants inside. It's a good idea to come in the evening and see these buildings lit up. There's an ice rink there at the moment which is also a nice way to spend an hour or two after visiting the

There are repairs being made to an area of garden beds. But, despite this, all of the park remains open. The view is great as many vessels are moored or traversing the water. Buskers even are welcome but unobtrusive. In spring it would look even better.
We went to go ice skating. It was a great time (1000 yen) for all day skating. Tons of outdoor and indoor shops to spend time and warm up. You can also take a pedicab to MM21 and the Ferris wheel.

Red Brick buildings are nicely conserved and preserved incorporated with Retail and F&B shops. Over the weekend, there was some event at the open areas. And as part of the conference, we have the cocktail at the upper level. Not bad for a drink and relax. Overall... Nice

Interesting place to check out on the waterfront. Wife enjoyed shopping at the many small shops. Most spoke English. There are a few food vendors here too that had interesting eats. Good place to go after the Mooneyes show.
A very Rustic looking building nice piece of architecture. Great background for some amazing photos.

It is a lot better than what I imagined earlier. There is Christmas stalls around this area with a large crowd too, allowing everyone to enjoy a rather western atmosphere at Yokohama bay area. While the brick house itself is more like a shopping center, its outside is far more
Always a beautiful spot and very rustic looking. Plenty of places to eat and shop and the water front is really nice. They even have a world market next door.

Had a great time browsing the many shops here. The winter market gave it a very christmassy feel. There was also an outdoor ice-skating area. We were there late and the kids were disappointed they could not skate. Do check out the timing if you are interested to skate. A

There is a short walk from the Subway. It's a factory converted into many shops. There are all sorts of stores and excellent restaurants inside. Bring money. I had the best apple pie ever at the apple pie shop. You can sit outside also and have a drink and rest. It gets crowded

In my opinion, it's a must Go place. Get a taste of modernity in an old quaint place. There are places to walk, to see, to shop and to eat. Buses circling the area makes it easy to get there and get out of there.
A place to shop and eat. Lots of push carts outside during Christmas time and nice decoration too. Lightings at night make the area looked really nice.

The Red Brick Warehouse, located on the waterfront, has an interesting mixture of shops as well as what appears to be a "food court", and at least one full restaurant on the top floor. Many of the goods are made in Japan, ranging from wood-carved items to hats, Yokohama Red

Japanese retail business are excellent with utilizing the limited space, and this is one of the many examples. By using the old brick warehouse, it adds a very nice Nostalgic atmosphere, and you will be surprised to see the inside! When I visit Yokohama, my home town, I never
The stores are interesting but on the expensive side. There was a cute Christmas display and shops between the buildings. The history section is rather small but very interesting.

This was an interesting place to spend an hour or two. The Red Brick Warehouse features many different eateries with an abundance of different foods. Additionally, there is also shopping on the upper floors where one can find little treasures in the boutique style outlets. As
Nicely renovated. Shops within and Xmas stalls outside. 2 blocks of shophouses with 3 floors each. Eateries and shops located throughout. Good experience and indeed a tourist magnet.

Good things are that this structure has been lovingly restored and is now a gorgeous shopping and eating emporium. It is also surrounds by Parkland and plazas giving a very pleasant atmosphere. You can walk from Sakuragicho station along the old train line, which is lovely. You
Unique building with lots of food choices mainly western style. Inside the building contain many shops with interesting and cute stuff. Great place for dating.
Good variety of stores, restaurants & food outlets. Right next to cruise terminal & park. Local tour bus stop is just right outside the building.

Many dozens of shops selling interesting things; not a typical tourist site with stores selling the same souvenirs. Much higher quality. Also several interesting restaurants, all comparatively expensive. We didn't buy anything, due to limited ability to carry stuff home from

Easy to access, with views across the bay & the Yokohama bay bridge. Lots of unusual shops & trendy shops. Variety of restaurants & eating places

The only problem is it doesn't open till late!! We were there at 9.30am and no shops were open! Some open at 10.30 and some at 11am. Very annoying for tourists! While some of the shops are different and sell craft, handmade things, not as many shops as I was expecting.
This Place is very beautiful! Good for Photos shooting here! And the brick house have many small shop and restaurant (western style) there!

Quite a number of restaurants and shops once you get inside but the quality is only average and the atmosphere in non-existent.

When looking through attractions at Yokohama, this one didn't make it on the list so I didn't check the description. We ended up strolling through on our first day because it was there and we were still a bit jet lagged and didn't want to do anything high on our list. There

Had lunch at one of the many fine restaurants located within the warehouse with my daughter - then went ice skating on the rink outside with my whole family. Recommend that you go when it is cold. You don't want to go on a warm day when the ice is melting.
Old XIXth Century warehouses modernized /converted into small shops, cafe, restaurants. Quite interesting to visit. But nothing special

It's a hipster's paradise. The old waterfront has been renewed. The old warehouses have been renovated and they now house mediocre high end shops and restaurants. The area is nice enough to walk around on a day with good weather. It's scenic and the building are nice and
The red brick shopping area is interesting and some good places to eat. Outside is an area for some entertainment.

The Red Brickhouse is another display of multiple small shops with the same junk as always. Above that a layer of restaurants. There's less to see from the authentic building, so all and all it's just another market...

Awesome place with cool events, the Red Brick Warehouse sits right next to the water. I went to a German Beer Festival here, and got to see live music, eat good food and see all the different kinds of beers avaliable

Visited one of the eateries on the third floor and walked the warehouses shops. Was a fun place, but definitely a place to bring your company and not necessary a place to meet others or be among a crowd. Some of the locations seemed to be popular date destinations. Please note
The beauty of the building is breath-taking but the stores inside are a little boring. Taking a slow walk around the building will be nice.

Nice to browse around the specialist shops here at any time of year and there's often some event happening in the courtyard, notable ones being the wonderful and very authentic Oktoberfest, complete with oompah band, the Christmas market and ice rink. Lovely views of the harbor,

This is a really nice old industrial building now converted to a really lovely shopping centre filled with lots of quirky little shops and places to get a bite to eat.

Lots of shops and eateries. I love industrial buildings renovated for commercial use so the setting is quite charming. Walking distance from other shopping areas.

The Red Brick Warehouse has a good variety of shops and restaurant areas. Was very busy and crowded when I visited on a Sunday morning. The restaurants were extremely busy and the one I visited, Bills, had to queue for around half an hour but worth the wait.

A nice place to visit but it can be very crowded. Prices seem to be higher than they should be. The do use the around the warehouses for festivals. A nice venue for that.

This place is huge....near the harbour..and you can see two brickhouses there... You must have enough time here....cause it takes time to walk around here...and to take a picture . This place is very nice and beautiful Inside the building,there is many stalls also restaurant.

It's a historical building with small shops. Late July it has a Sparkling Twilight and has food stalls and live concert. Everybody sat on the grass. The fireworks started at 7:30pm. It's gorgeous!
Nice building, good shops, a few restaurants and cafes. Shops are smaller ones, not this typical mall style, what is good. Good for an hour.

Nice rainy day or too hot-of-a-day option. A lot of original shops all under one roof but prices in some of the shops can be high

Yokohama is a laid back alternative to Tokyo. Red Brick Warehouse has easy access from the train, great views, and several dining choices. Great fun at night and (typically) interesting activities during the days on the weekends. GET OUT OF YOUR HOTEL ROOM!!!

The place is really cool, it has trendy shops and cool restaurants, that are also good. It's close to the sea, so when in summer it's a nice place to refresh yourselves, plus some of the summer festivals are close to it. All in all, I"ll say that it's worth a visit.

For both shopping and to visit a historical land mark. You must visit this place. Kept in very good condition. For the Railway Historians out there. You can view the original station near by.
Nice site with lots of restaurants and gift shop. We saw a motorcycle show its was amazing. 1 min away from the ocean

Great place to shop and wander around while at the famous port area of Yokohama! Make sure you stop by for a quick visit to the odd shops there!
I thought this was a good use of an old building. Cute shops and places to eat. Right on the water, so great views in the plaza of the warehouse.

This place is good for taking pictures and also admiring the bay. Its also famous for exhibitions on weekends. we love coming here to dine at Bill's. Now that Granny smith is newly opened. will visit it more often!
We strolled past this area and it was beginning to wake up around ten o'clock It was full of coffee shops and souvenirs building was nice to look at but nothing stood out!!!

nice place to click pictures.a beautiful restored landmark with shopping n restaurants around.can get a little crowded on holidays but well worth a visit if in yokohama.
I always like to come back here. There are plenty of things to do, some nice restaurants and every other weekend an event going on.

Character buildings with so much history. Building have been restored recently and inside is pretty nice. Now, there are shops, food courts and souvenir shops.
Beautiful landmark with many delicious restaurants and shopping. Must visit but need not spend too much time in it

outstanding red in a sea of blue and yellow and grey. shopping but it is the structure that would catch your attention. walking from Chinatown pass the sea front. go see whats there just to get away from the cold or sun.
A collection of small shops under one roof and lots of good restaurants. Great place to wonder round and window shop.

Enjoyed strolling through this shopping area. I like artsy and unique things so this was a treat. The Chestnut ice cream at Bashamichi Ice was delicious!! Could not get enough. The coffee shop had good selections too. I would definitely go back for a visit.

Worth a visit to see how these two warehouses from the Meiji era have been transformed. Quaint shops and good selection of food in the basement.
well worth a stop, a nice selections of resturants and bars, combined with trendy shopping, a great way to spend an hour in Yohohama

The "Akarenga" Red Brick Warehouse is one of Yokohama's most popular destinations for both tourists and locals alike. It's a great place to enjoy a walk or small picnic, or just sit around and stare at the sea. Because of its large open spaces, Akarenga is often the site for
good for shopping and lots of restaurants. it is a beautiful place to visit. You can find many products are made of Japan, too! I love it and the prices are very affordable.

Some really nice restaurants with a great view and lots of odd little shops to browse through. Not a place for cheap shopping but a beautiful building and definitely worth a look and a nice dinner with a view if you sit outside.

As others have suggested, this is a attraction not just to the tourist but to the localist as well. Very relaxing place as you walk along the shore beside the red brick buildings. I recommend this place when you are visiting this city.
I like the outside of the building rather than the inside. The shops doesn't interest me much. The view outside is very nice.

This place is actually a shopping and dining places which is converted from a warehouse. Lot of eatery and unique shops. Good stroll by the bay.
mostly just shopping and a few restaurants....worth a stroll on the outside...................................................

An interesting place to browse through diverse stalls, from souvenirs to clothes to home wares. Several bars with waterfront veranda location to watch the sunset and some good places to eat in the evening
A nice place with quite a few different eating places. All from typical Janaese food and fresh fish and meat places and some italian style pizza.

Awesome building and Octoberfest on while their. Building is a very nice market and lots of stuff to buy. Top floor has a bar for the guys to wait for the ladies. Lots of food stalls as well so is definitely worth a visit

Red brick warehouse is a very nice place, not for shopping or for dinning. but the location and the area its soo nice at night, it get's better when there is an event around. Like German beer fest. or Xmas/New Year celebration, I miss living there. you can take a nice walk from
Great place to shop and have a meal. Old red brick port side warehouse of yore now modernised from the inside.

If you are in Yokohama and enjoy eating and shopping this is the place for you. It is on the waterfront, many restaurants and shops to visit. Very close to other attractions like World Porter Mall, the Big Ferris Wheel, Yashmita Park, and NYK Maritime Museum.
Very different shopping and products in the old warehouses from beer to bedroom furniture, its all there with lots of free samples of food and drinks from vendors well worth a visit.

Great shopping and food all housed within a distinctive and vintage building. The shops were very interesting and Bill's restaurant is definitely worth a look in. The outside space was used well also - there was a mini beach and park, alongside terraza seating when we were there
Nice shopping, kinda pricey. Interesting restaurants. Nice place to walk around and see the area. Not a must do unless you are in the area.

it was a historical building that was converted into a some sort of a mall. Perfect for photo session.

I noticed the building because of its red bricks and I went in... it is full of little shops of souvenirs, foods, clothes, etc. You can spend several hours there, maybe if the weather is not so good to be outside.

There's a lot of restaurants at this place. The brick house is unique but nothing special. The harbor view was good too.

Great location for photographer with beautiful view of Minato Mirai at night. A Romantic place with beautiful decorations during Christmas season, you' ll find a lot of love birds in this area.
An enjoyable day spent exploring the two warehouses filled with quirky stores and excellent food. Very pretty during the Christmas season with decorations. Definitely worth the trip

This is a nice reprieve from the hustle and bustle of the city. Located in an open area the warehouse looks immaculately preserved. Stop in for the multi-level shops on the second and third floor or hit one of the nice restaurants on the first floor

just opposite to yokohama international passenger terminal, there is street artist doing some show just infront of the building. inside the building was quite crowded when we were there. most of shops are pricy, a hat is 10000 above, of cause good workmanship and quality
I was fascinated by the many stores in this place! Its worth spending some time going through the warehouse. I did not have much time this trip but I am already looking forward to my next trip there!

Well worth a visit when walking through this region. Nice shops in a historic building. Bought a Red Brick Beer, good stuff!

It is a little historical site that is very well preserved. Some cute artsy exhibitions, some cute artsy designs, some cute little restaurants. It is all in all a very cute artsy-fartsy place with a historic backdrop.

Great little shops (not too touristy) in a historic building. A museum is attached- would have liked to have had the time to visit the museum. On weekends there are sometimes special events going on on the grounds. Great fun. Go on a weekend if possible.
This place seemed to be all atmosphere, which was great. But the food was expensive and the range of shops was limited.

Nice restaurants and very fascinating old red brick building with nice small shops where you can see some performances or concerts or just chill out with friends.

Nice place to shop, bit of everything both western and local, would recommend trying some of the food in the eating places.

text.wiki:
Yokohama Hakkeijima Sea Paradise (横浜・八景島シーパラダイス, Yokohama Shīparadaisu) is an amusement park consisting of an aquarium, shopping mall, hotel, marina and amusement rides. It is located in Kanagawa-ken, Yokohama, Japan. It opened for business on May 8, 1993.
It is a pay-as-you-go theme park, having no gates or admission charges. Visitors have the option of buying a day pass or paying for each attraction separately. With 4,770,000 visitors in 2007, it ranks sixth among Asian amusement parks in terms of attendance.
It is accessed by the Kanazawa Seaside Line.


== In film ==
Yokohama Hakkeijima Sea Paradise is seen destroyed by Godzilla in the Kaiju film, Godzilla Against Mechagodzilla.


== External links ==
Yokohama Hakkeijima SEA PARADISE (English)
